channel.title: Unschool Pages of Our Lives
channel.description: Follow a family deeply rooted in unschooling as they share heartwarming stories, daily adventures, and candid discussions that inspire all ages to embrace the freedom of learning through life's experiences.
channel.author: KIDO Family Ranch
channel.itunes:author: KIDO Family Ranch
channel.itunes:summary: Follow a family deeply rooted in unschooling as they share heartwarming stories, daily adventures, and candid discussions that inspire all ages to embrace the freedom of learning through life's experiences.

item.title: **NEW** Unschool Pages Hub Discussions
item.description:
**NEW** Unschool Pages Hub Discussions:

Dive deeper into the unschooling journey with Unschool Pages Hub Discussions—a new show segment designed specifically for parents. Each episode unpacks practical strategies, real-life experiences, and expert insights to help you navigate and thrive in the world of self-directed learning. From addressing common challenges to sharing inspiring success stories, this is your space to connect, learn, and grow as a supportive guide in your child’s learning adventure.


In this Episode:

Unschooling is more than an educational choice—it’s a lifestyle that celebrates freedom, growth, and creativity. As you embark on or continue this journey, remember: there’s no "right way" to unschool, only your family’s way.

Together, we’re redefining learning. Let’s inspire a generation of thinkers, doers, and changemakers—one child, one moment, and one joyful discovery at a time.

item.title: Tornado Tales: Sheltering in Place and Staying Safe
item.description:
Signs of a tornado appear, and the KIDO Family gets ready to shelter in place. There’s no panic, but hints of stress and wonder are in the air. The children ask their mommy if they’re safe from nature’s might or if they’ll come face to face with a tornado tonight.

I’m sure you’ve noticed storms gathering force, making us suspect someone, somewhere, is giving Earth a makeover this year. We’ve experienced weather like never before: snowstorms, earthquakes, wildfires, hail, mud from heavy rains, and dust from harmattans. Flooding in some places, tornadoes blowing others away.

But today, things got real! A wall of clouds covered our nature view, and our phone alarms wailed. We gathered our boots to bring you the story about being tornado-proof.

In this episode, we discuss what we’ve learned about tornadoes, sheltering in place, the Enhanced Fujita Scale, and following storm chaser trails. We’re safe, with our shoes, sweaters, and some games, sitting in the closet, sharing the knowledge we’ve gained.


Photo & Video Credits

Video by Coverr from Pexels: https://www.pexels.com/video/footage-of-tornado-853833/

item.title: Field Trip to the Fort Worth Water Gardens
item.description: Join us for an exciting field trip episode as we visit the Fort Worth Water Gardens! This special outing offers a refreshing escape into one of Texas' most stunning architectural and ecological sites. Listen in as we explore the serene water features, delve into the garden's design, and discover the educational aspects of this urban oasis. Whether you're a nature enthusiast, architecture aficionado, or just looking for a peaceful break from the everyday, this episode is sure to captivate and educate. Don't miss this unique journey with the Unschool Pages of Our Lives podcast!

item.title: Storytime: Suspended Part 2 The Best Thing Ever
item.description: It's StoryTime! Join us on an exciting journey with Jeremy, a young boy whose suspension from school turned into the best thing ever! Dive into his story of exploration and discovery as he embraces the unschooling lifestyle. From flying airplanes to learning about dinosaurs and cooking with his dad, Jeremy's adventure is a testament to the endless possibilities of self-directed learning. Get inspired to unleash your own potential on this episode of Unschool Pages of Our Lives!

item.title: Suspended: What If It's the Best Thing Ever?
item.description:
Imagine a world where getting suspended from school opens the door to a whole new way of learning. In this episode, we dive into the realm of unschooling, where freedom and curiosity replace traditional classrooms. Join us as we explore how a suspension could be a hidden opportunity to discover the wonders of atoms, dinosaurs, trees, and peacocks. It's time to question the status quo and consider: What if getting suspended from school was the best thing ever? Let's embark on this thought-provoking journey together!

Dive into a lively discussion on the benefits of unschooling, where freedom and curiosity lead the way. Join us as we debunk myths about atoms, marvel at prehistoric creatures, and uncover the wonders of nature, from the vibrant colors of peacocks to the fascinating world of trees. Whether you're suspended from school or simply seeking a different path to learning, this episode is a journey into the heart of unschooling and the endless possibilities it offers.

Get inspired to unleash your own potential on this episode of Unschool Pages of Our Lives!

item.title: Unschooler Ask Experts Questions: Annie Tassani Smith
item.description:
We ask Expert natural learning Author and momma Annie Tassani Smith some serious unschool questions that get to the core of our shared genre bending narratives the bridge both fiction and non-fiction memoir literary buckets. We talk about questions we had from the book, go on shared unschool lifestyle tangents and connect on lived experiences we not onlt capture in our books but also have in common even from miles and miles apart.


Dive into "We ARE at School" by Annie Tassani Smith

item.title: Storytime: We ARE at School Read Aloud
item.description: Join us for a special storytime episode as we dive into the heart-centered world of 'We ARE at School' by Annie Tassani Smith. Experience the relaxed flow of a homeschool life through this captivating read-aloud, perfect for young listeners and their families who are curious about homeschool or unschooling. Get cozy and let your imagination roam as we explore the adventures and joys of homeschool. Don't miss this delightful journey on 'Unschool Pages of Our Lives'!" item.title: Unleashing Creativity: Making Movies & Music as Unschoolers
item.description: Dance, stomp, clap and sing into the world of improv music-making with us in this beat making, song writing episode! We'll explore the boundless creativity of making music, from using body noises to banging on objects. Hear a story about crafting tunes from everyday sounds and discover how unschooling frees you to spend endless hours appreciating and creating music. Join us for a symphony of fun and inspiration as we celebrate the joy of musical exploration on 'Unschool Pages of Our Lives'! Grab our Create Your Own Adventure Activity Book https://kidofamilyranch.com

item.title: MardiGras & Carnival Examined By Unschoolers
item.description:
We just ended Caribbean Carnival season or Mardi Gras season, and this episode is packed with Carnival facts. From Mardi Gras in Louisiana to talking about the mockery of Carnival. We're talking about the babies and the cakes. We're talking about things being thrown, costumes, music, dance, celebrations in the streets, throwing coconuts. How steel pans are made and bucking THE MAN to stand up and show pride for who you are. This is no small episode. It's packed with fun facts, serious facts, and lots of celebration. So sit back, relax. Get ready for this episode of "Mardi Gras and Carnival, Examined by Unschoolers".

Grab a signed copy of our book: "Unschool Discoveries: Venturing into the Unknown"

item.title: Swamp Biomes Unearthed - A Mardi Gras Wildlife Adventure
item.description:
Crawfish or Crayfish? It’s Mardi Gras season and we’re headed to the Bayous and swampland biomes of Louisiana to uncover the animals that live within the low-lying marshy, wetland creeks —where fish and plankton thrive! We discover the Ankylosaurus survived to become Alligator Snapping Turtles. We visit the kings of this planet genus Panthera, paying respect to their apex-ness. We uncover boars, eagles, swamp rats and red belly piranha. When we started the journey we knew there were frogs. But Dino Robot thought all there was were small creatures. Wow, were they in for a surprise! Join us on this wild ride as we uncover the mysteries of the swamp biomes of earth and what humans might taste like to an alligator from Miss Animalia? All this and more on this Swamp Biomes Unearthed - A Mardi Gras Wildlife Adventure episode of Unschool Pages of Our Lives.


Grab a signed copy of our book:

⁠⁠"Unschool Discoveries: Venturing into the Unknown"⁠ by Danii Oliver ⁠⁠https://kidofamilyranchpublishing.square.site/⁠⁠

item.title: Minecraft Explored: Biomes, Mobs, and More - Part 2
item.description:
This is Part 2 of our Minecraft week and we're diving into scandalous research about the pixelated world of Minecraft's diverse biomes and terrifying mobs that inhabit them! This episode is all about uncovering the facts: we're discovering fascinating insights into these virtual Minecraft ecosystems, discovering the quirks and features of different mobs, and uncovering tips and tricks that even pro players might not know. Whether you're a Minecraft newbie or a pro at crafting, there's always something new to learn. So, pick up your pickaxe and let's start digging into the rich, creative realms of Minecraft together!


Grab a signed copy of our book:

⁠"Unschool Discoveries: Venturing into the Unknown" by Danii Oliver ⁠https://kidofamilyranchpublishing.square.site/⁠

item.title: Minecraft Discovery Engagement Week!
item.description:
Today we have a very different episode from anything that we've done in the past. It's not reading day and we're not necessarily going to go into our new podcast segment structure. We're just going to explore Minecraft today. It's gaming week here at the KIDO Family Ranch, and we've decided the game that we're going to play Minecraft, because it will allow me to be creative and build things, as well as have a little bit of struggle in the survival mode. Coming up next the kids are going to teach me how to play Minecraft!

It's gaming week here at the KIDO Family Ranch, and we've decided the game that we're going to play Minecraft, because it will allow me to be creative and build things, as well as have a little bit of struggle in the survival mode. Coming up next the kids are going to teach me how to play Minecraft!

item.title: Audiobook | Unschool Discoveries : Venturing into the Unknown
item.description:
Immerse yourself in the audiobook edition of 'Unschool Discoveries: Venturing into the Unknown,' a journey that redefines learning and adventure. Follow the captivating experiences of our unschooled protagonists as they explore the world around them, learning from every encounter and challenge. This story isn’t just about discovery; it’s about seeing the world through eyes unbound by conventional learning, where every moment is a lesson and every experience, a treasure. Tune in for a narrative that celebrates curiosity, freedom, and the joy of learning in the most unexpected ways!

item.title: Marsupial Mania: From Boodies to Tree Kangaroos
item.description: Dive deep into the captivating world of marsupials in this enlightening episode! Discover the wonders of boodies, joeys, and the mesmerizing tree kangaroos. We read and learn about animal self-defense, momma kangaroos unschooling her joey and the charming quirks of Koalas. We unveil the mysteries of finding water in warm solids, sugar gladers and not mice, mice looking marsupials. And if you've got a termite problem, stick around to find out which marsupial might just become your best friend. Join us for a marsupial-filled adventure that promises knowledge and fun!

item.title: Exploring Our Environment: Unschooling Adventures
item.description: Home From School? Dive into a whirlwind of learning with our unschoolers in this episode! From dinosaurs to the F-16 and Concorde planes, we cover it a lot. We explore the fascinating eating habits of snakes, delve into how the vision impaired navigate the world, and observe the changing seasons. Even Dr. Super Mom is on a quest for knowledge too, seeking books on research, design, and people management. Plus, it's reading day, and all our storybooks are about learning what's in your Environment, the First of the 5 Ease Methodology. This episode is a whirlwind journey answering the ever-present question: "What is this?" in the most exciting ways! Grab your copy of our book "Unschool Discoveries: Venturing into the Unknown" to learn more about how to have your own unschool learning adventures. Visit https://unschooldiscoveries.com

item.title: Bruno Revisited: Embracing Mental Health and Imperfection Part 2
item.description: Back with 'Let's Talk About Bruno: Part 2', we dive deeper into the world of mental health support and the power of hugs. This episode explores the pitfalls of perfection, how to sidestep burnout and depression, and why prickly problems sometimes need a gentle touch. We're unraveling the complex layers of our brains and the beauty of embracing imperfection. Join us for a journey into understanding, empathy, and the importance of being kind to ourselves and others.

item.title: Let's Talk About Bruno: Understanding Emotions and EQ: Part 1
item.description:
In this episode on navigating complex emotions and their impact on children, we delve into how openness and emotional intelligence can aid in coping with life's challenges. This discussion is rich with insights, discussion starters and tools, focuses on EQ (Emotional Intelligence) and how we can better understand and manage feelings like depression and anxiety. Plus, we explore joy with Dino Robot and give our take on films that touch on these themes. (Spoiler alert for 'Inside Out' and 'Encanto' – it's about time we talked about them!)


For those seeking further resources, check our newsletter/ blog for more support.

Unschool Pages Hub: bit.ly/unschoolpageshub

item.title: Wild Cats and Mythical Tales: A Feline Adventure
item.description: Explore the realm of wild cats, panthers, jaguars, leopards - where do they live? What's the difference? Dive into the world of saber tooth tigers aka Smilodons, LIGERS, TIGONS, and ‘Poo-bears’, OH MY! In this episode of 'Unschool Pages of Our Lives,' we also unravel the story of the Thunder Cats and the goddesses Sekhmet and Bastet. It’s a captivating blend of wild cat facts, fiction, and lore. Join us for this feline-filled journey!

item.title: Pet Drama Tales - It’s Only the Beginning
item.description:
Unschool Friends today we Dive into our long awaited pet universe episode “Pet Drama Tales - It’s Only the Beginning”. In Part 1 We discuss who makes great pets, how FISH are high-maintenance paintings that swim. Wanting PIGS but NOT turning them into pepperoni. We countdown our RABBIT tales from five to until there was one and reminisce about the four DOGS that graced and then left the Unschool Pages of Our Lives. Plus, get the scoop on the annoying CAT that adopted us, after being abandoned by our new neighbors. It's a wild, furry ride of “Pet Drama Tales, It’s Only the Beginning”. Welcome to part 1!

Grab your copy of "Unschool Discoveries" Book 1: https://unschooldiscoveries.com

item.title: For Palestine and Indigenous People
item.description: Taking a stand is somes hard. Taking a stand is sometimes a calling. Taking a stand is what some have to do to survive oppression. Taking a stand isn't always possible when your world is crumbling. Today, we share 3 stories of inspiration and hope for those we simply wish for life, liberty, and freedom. For all Indigenous people suffering under the consequences of continued colonialism, for Palestine.

item.title: Storytime: Orange Glad it Halloween Amber Brown
item.description: Amber Brown has come up with a fantastic costume, but it's a secret. She won't even tell Justin, no matter what he bribes her with. But one thing worries Amber all day. Her parents had a fight before school. What if they don't make up before their traditional Halloween dinner (macaroni and cheese, carrots, and orange juice)? What if they are in bad moods during trick-or-treating? Halloween is one of Amber's favorite holidays, and of course, this one turns out to be as wonderful as all the rest.

item.title: Storytime: Looking for a Jumbie by Tracey Baptiste
item.description: Tonight, Explorers, our '7 Nights of Fright' brings you another Caribbean story based on the Jumbies of Trinidadian Folklore! Listen to the journey of a brave young girl who goes out into the dark jungle looking for jumbies against her mother’s fearful warning. But there’s a twist... showing us that sometimes... appearances can be very deceiving! Get ready for another Trinidadian fright."

item.title: Imogeemo Reimagined: A Modern Twist on Trinidadian Lore
item.description: Dive into a captivating episode as we breathe new life into 'Imogeemo,' a cherished Trinidadian folklore. Journey with us through a tale that weaves the mystical threads of the past into the vibrant fabric of the present. In this unique story, familiar enchantments meet contemporary twists, captivating listeners with a blend of tradition and modern-day intrigue. Join us for an unforgettable adventure that bridges generations, celebrating the timeless magic of Caribbean storytelling.

item.title: Halloween Crafting: A Cosplay Adventure
item.description:
Join us in this thrilling episode where imagination, artistry, and engineering collide in the realm of costume creation! As we dive into our ambitious plans for iconic characters like Poison Ivy, glitched-out Corrupted Sims, Darth Vader, and the enigmatic Darth Daddyous, each step becomes a lesson in creativity and resourcefulness.

Journey through discussions on crafting the perfect plumbob, strategizing Darth Vader's cape dynamics, and the existential costume crisis of Darth Daddyous. Does he opt for a frightening glowing mask or character makeup? Or will he immerse himself in the lore as a unique Sith Lord? The adventure doesn't stop there; we're also looking back at our DIY hall of fame featuring Baby Batman and her parents Harley Quinn & The Joker Miss Frizzle & Curious George and the time Darth Daddyous was Clark Kent, no no superman just geeky Clark Kent, and more!

Plus When the realization hits that we're out of batteries, it's all hands on deck to innovate a solution for our Sim's shining plumbob. This episode is more than a costume-making saga; it's a testament to the unschooling spirit. We're not just making outfits; we're engineering dreams, designing realities, and sewing the very fabric of our imagination. Get ready for a tale of exact-o knives, hot glue, grit, and glitter!


Wait what? There’s no glitter, please no glitter!


Grab a copy of our debut Unschooling storybook "Unschool Discoveries: Venturing into the Unknown" Now Available on Amazon bit.ly/unschoolbook


Learn more about real world Unschooling on our Unschool Pages Hub bit.ly/unschoolpageshub

item.title: Storytime: Grumpy Monkey Don't Be Scared
item.description: Dive into an uplifting storytelling adventure with 'Grumpy Monkey: Don't Be Scared' by Suzanne Lang, where we explore the quirky challenges of facing our fears. Through laughter and relatable moments, this read-aloud captures the essence of courage and the joy of finding light in dark times. Join us for a heartwarming journey that reassures listeners it's okay to be scared, but it's even more fun to overcome it together!

item.title: Real Zombie Facts Uncovered: Nature's Undead
item.description: Join us on a spine-chilling journey into the eerie world of nature's very own zombies. Delve into how certain fungi astonishingly take control of bodies, leading to hair-raising facts about body-snatched ant zombies. As we navigate through complex scientific names and marvel at alarming head eruptions, Dino Robot devises a playful plot to use fungi on their mom. This throwback episode not only introduces us to the undead wonders of nature but also serves as a testament to the remarkable growth of our unschoolers. Dive into these uncanny facts and marvel at the transformative power of unschooling.

item.title: Storytime: The Good, The Bad, and The Spooky
item.description: Join us as we delve into the enthralling pages of Jory John's 'The Good, The Bad, and The Spooky,' a tale teeming with suspense, humor, and life lessons. As we navigate through the spooky yet endearing adventures, we uncover the importance of friendship, bravery, and understanding the grey areas between good and bad. Don't miss this captivating storytime episode that promises a mix of giggles, gasps, and huddling a little closer together!

item.title: Rainy Day Protocol with Dino Robot, the Paleontologist

Experience a special day as Dr. Super Mom and Dinosaur Robot of All Dinosaurs bond over shared passions, tackling game challenges, stress management, and budgeting basics. item.title: Unschoolers Transitioning: From Teens to Empowered Adults
item.description:
Unschoolers becoming ADULTS? Scary! Not at all.

In this insightful episode, we dive deep into a teen's transition to adulthood. The path is layered, from establishing firm boundaries and speaking assertively with older adults, to managing family dynamics and avoiding the pitfalls of misplaced responsibility. As our young unschooler sets up for future success, they navigate the challenges of independence, all while imparting lessons to the adults who cherish them. This isn't just an episode—it's a sneak peek into our exclusive bonus content. Especially tailored for the teen and adult unschoolers, join us for a candid look at growing up unschooled.

item.title: A Month of Spooky, Scary and Deadly Creature Episodes
item.description:
Get ready for a month of spooky, scary and deadly creature episodes.

Prepare for a hair-raising journey this October as we unleash a series of episodes dedicated to the spooky, the scary, and the downright deadly creatures that haunt our tales. Each week, we'll delve into stories that will send shivers down your spine, from ghostly whispers to the monsters under the bed. Don't dare miss a single episode; subscribe and join us if you dare, for a month filled with fear, excitement, and the creatures of the night!

Brace yourselves for "7 Nights of Fright," our chilling countdown filled with back-to-back spooky bedtime stories.

item.title: Storytime: Exclusive Free Audiobook - Unschool Discoveries: Venturing Into The Unknown by Danii Oliver
item.description:
Limited Time Episode:

Dive deep into the vibrant world of unschooling with this exclusive free audiobook episode! Journey alongside curious explorers as they embark on a quest of self-directed learning, unraveling the mysteries and wonders of the world around them. Authored by the talented Danii Oliver, "Unschool Discoveries: Venturing Into The Unknown" paints a vivid picture of the magic and challenges that come with forging one's own educational path. This special release is a testament to the beauty of curiosity, the thrill of discovery, and the boundless possibilities that unschooling offers. Immerse yourself in this captivating narrative and let the adventure unfold!

item.title: Anniversary Special: A Year of Storytime Magic & Unschool Discoveries!
item.description: Celebrate with us as 'Unschool Pages of Our Lives' turns ONE! Dive into this special anniversary episode where we revisit our top 3 listener favorites: 'The Littlest Yak', 'Scaredy Squirrel at the Beach', and 'Bubbles Up'. But that's not all! We're also thrilled to share our very own stories from the 'Unschool Discoveries' series, penned by Dr. Super Mom aka Danii Oliver. Join us for 'Venturing Into The Unknown', 'The Enchanted Tent: Travels Through England', and our latest, 'Expansive Growth'. item.title: Unschoolers Ask Experts Questions: Grandma's Trinidadian Doubles Interview
item.description:
Dive into the flavorful world of Trinidadian cuisine as Miss Animalia gets the inside scoop on making authentic Doubles! In this delightful episode, our young host chats with her grandmother, unearthing family secrets behind the perfect bara and curry channa. Discover the rich heritage, passion, and traditions encapsulated in every bite of this beloved Trinidadian street food. Perfect for food lovers and culture enthusiasts, tune in and savor the tales from our family kitchen to your ears.

Trinidadian Doubles, Authentic Doubles Recipe, Grandma's Kitchen, Trinidadian Cuisine, Miss Animalia, Bara Recipe, Curry Channa, Traditional Cooking, Family Secrets, Street Food Stories.

item.title: Unschool Unscripted: A Day in the Life
item.description: Step into the vibrant world of unschooling with 'Unschool Unscripted: A Day in the Life.' From the candid chatter of talk radio to the imaginative realms of playtime, this episode offers a glimpse into the daily dynamics of self-directed learning. Hear firsthand the thoughts, ideas, questions, and stories that bubble up when kids lead their education. It's a slice-of-life showcase, revealing the unfiltered, creative, and exploratory spirit of the unschooling journey. Tune in for an authentic audio snapshot of learning unleashed! A slice-of-life moment with children engaged in self-directed learning and play. This episode is a natural and spontaneous exploration of everyday curiosities, highlighting the unschooling experience where the environment itself becomes a playful classroom. The discussions range from making connections with pop culture references like cartoon characters to practical life skills such as dishwashing and sewing, all wrapped in a narrative of imaginative play and sibling interaction.Given the organic and multifaceted nature this candid episode encapsulates the essence of unschooling, while showcasing playful and varied topics. The themes that emerge are from the unschooled children's interactions and the learning moments they experience. --- Send in a voice message: https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/unschoolpagesofourlives/message

item.title: Storytime: s, Please! By Cheryl Yau Chepusova
item.description: A to Z noodle dishes from around the world. Are you hungry? Noodles, Please! provides a culinary tour of the world, highlighting cuisines from over a dozen different countries. With each new letter, a new dish is introduced identifying its country of origin and name written in both English and the country’s native language. Whether learning about Tallarines Verdes for the first time, or a Naengmyeon aficionado, readers young and old are sure to slurp this one right up.
